page.title: 17EMPLOYMENT AND INDUSTRY
page.content: In the Tidmarsh area many people are retired. Despite the high levels of national unemployment most of the young have jobs. Of the few unemployed most of them live in the Wakeman's Council Estate to the west of Pangbourne. Outside farming, there is not a great deal of local employment in the rural areas, many residents are commuters 20 people are employed at Tarmac Topblock, established in 1946 as a cottage industry. It is owned by CAEC Havard of Bedford and concentrates on producing building blocks. Many locals think the firm obtrusive in the rural environment, but opposition has diminished because of the employment provided. Tidmarsh Forge employs two blacksmiths. It incorporates a mini-museum showing what the Forge makes.
